string-array.name: about
string-array.item: PassLoc is an open-source password manager application that uses sql-cipher to store data on your device.
Needless to say that all the data stored in the database are encrypted with strong and reliable encryption (AES256).
PassLoc does not store any data on the cloud. Hence, this app does not require an internet connection to function.
The source code can be found at github.com/mubashirtanveerayon/PassLoc .

string-array.name: encryption
string-array.item: The database name is the name that is used to create the database with a unique extension(.loc) on your device.
The database is first secured with a password you choose. After that, .
Though the encryption algorithm uses several keys to encrypt your data the secret key is considered to be the mother key.
Even if someone gains access to the password-protected database file they will not be able to decrypt your data without this key.
This also means that if you happen to forget your secret key the database file becomes unusable.
So, it is recommended to use a secret key that is actually secret(not like your contact number or date of birth) and that you can remember.

string-array.name: ui
string-array.item: In this version of the app most of the ui-interactions are done using the floating action button and the bottom navigation panel.
Want a secret key suggestion? You can always use the unique password generator
The access panel is for creating/logging into database files on your device.
The view panel is for viewing the your saved password.
The logout panel is used to logout/disconnect from database.
